subject_terms_3: Photography Great Britain. Royal Air Force.
physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a group of three men and one woman. The man on the left is wearing a white shirt and long pants, while the other two men are dressed in military uniform. The woman is dressed in a white shirt and skirt. Three of them are sitting on the ledge, while one man is squating on the steps, and facing towards the woman.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of group outside a house
subject_terms_1: group portraits military personnel soldiers snapshots
